message.content:
<<<api>>>: Runtime.getRuntime().exec
<<<code>>>: ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder("/bin/bash", "-c", "keytool -genkey -v -keystore test.keystore -alias test -keyalg RSA -sigalg SHA1withRSA -keysize 2048 -validity 10000");
pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
Process proc = pb.start();
BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(proc.getInputStream()));
String line;
while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
    System.out.println(line);
}
int exitCode = proc.waitFor();
System.out.println("Exited with error code " + exitCode);
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of using Runtime.getRuntime().exec(), it is recommended to use ProcessBuilder. ProcessBuilder allows you to set the command and arguments separately, and also provides more control over the process execution. In this code, we create a ProcessBuilder with the command and arguments, redirect the error stream to the input stream, start the process, and read the output using a BufferedReader. Finally, we wait for the process to exit and print the exit code.
